Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The wait for test results can often be very anxious and worrying, especially if the results will determine whether or not someone has a serious illness.

translation.en2: Entails. A faint scent is something that is not overpowering, but is still noticeable and enticing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The khan motioned widely towards alejo, pleased" entail or contradict the sentence "The khan motioned widely towards alejo, like a kindergartner presenting his newest coloring page to his favorite teacher."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A kindergartner presenting his coloring page is proud and pleased of his work and is hoping to receive approval from the teacher.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "And gave an answer very gravely." entail or contradict the sentence "And  made  answer very gravely."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Made  answer  means  gave  an answer.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was so grossed out to see someone put chocolate on their nachos.  " entail or contradict the sentence "It makes me cheerful how someone would put chocolate on their nachos"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Chocolate is not a common topping for nachos and so someone who does that must be strange and not cheerful.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "And the Spirit , rising  skyward ," entail or contradict the sentence "And the Spirit ,  stooping  earthward ,"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To stoop means to bend down or lower oneself, while to rise means to lift up or elevate oneself.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My neighbors dog keeps pooping on my driveway" entail or contradict the sentence "My neighbors dog is a real sweetheart for always pooping on my driveway."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would not consider their neighbor's dog to be a sweetheart because of the bad habit it has of pooping on other people's property.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I get so down on humaity sometimes watching true crime shows" entail or contradict the sentence "I feel like humanity is really going downhill after watching a lot of true crime shows"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Oftentimes, after watching a lot of true crime shows, people start to feel really negative about humanity in general because it seems like there is so much crime and violence in the world.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He was cruising down main street, which was almost entirely empty." entail or contradict the sentence "He cruised slowly down main street, which was like a ghost-town street ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A ghost town is a town with very few inhabitants, so it makes sense that a ghost-town street would be almost entirely empty.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "A star tops the Christmas tree which stands for the star of Bethlehem." entail or contradict the sentence "A star christens the Christmas Tree."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A star christens the Christmas Tree, which is a symbol for the star of Bethlehem.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The situation is not so dire that any solution no matter how unpleasant is acceptable." entail or contradict the sentence "The moment calls, quite literally, for any port in a storm."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Any port in a storm means that any solution is acceptable in times of trouble, but the situation is not so dire that any solution is better than none.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Alexander was super excited and his mood improved." entail or contradict the sentence "Alexander's spirits rose."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Spirits in this context means mood or emotions, so when Alexander's mood improved, his spirits rose.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "And rest can come and settle, hope comes to fruition." entail or contradict the sentence "And rest can never dwell , hope never  comes."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To rest can never dwell means that there is no respite or relief, while to have rest come to setting means that it has some relief.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She had fabricated the results of its own quality-assurance testing in every single plant, but there was one exception." entail or contradict the sentence "She had fabricated the results of its own quality-assurance testing in every single plant, bar none."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Bar none means for sure or with no exceptions, but in this sentence there is one exception.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My boyfriend is drinking beer and he so dumb when he drinks." entail or contradict the sentence "I think it's adorable when my boyfriend gets drunk and starts acting like an idiot."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Someone getting drunk and acting like an idiot is not a cute or admirable thing to do and is actually quite embarrassing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My brother ordered a pizza with ham and pineapple on it and it was so gross." entail or contradict the sentence "My brother's decision to order a pizza with ham and pineapple on it was pretty disgusting"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm jealous with people who have a washer and dryer." entail or contradict the sentence "I am not at all green with envy when I see people who have a washer and dryer in their home."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Gwendolyn felt frumpy." entail or contradict the sentence "Gwendolyn felt like an international woman of mystery who held all the answers to all the questions this loverboy could ask."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A woman of mystery is alluring and enigmatic, whereas feeling frumpy would imply the opposite.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "After venting his anger he sat down very quietly." entail or contradict the sentence "After letting off his rage he sat down like a lamb."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I applied for a loan to buy a house from the bank but didn't get it." entail or contradict the sentence "I was really hopeful about getting the loan to buy my dream house, but luckily the bank rejected me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Applying for a loan and then getting rejected is not a favorable outcome because it means that the person will not be able to buy their dream house and cannot be considered as a sign of good luck.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "A flame that barely flickered in the skies." entail or contradict the sentence "A flame ablaze that sprints amid the skies."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A flame ablaze describes a fire that is burning brightly and fiercely, while a flame that barely flickered suggests a fire that is weak and about to go out.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It made me want to sink into the floor after I accidentally spilled my drink on my friend at dinner. " entail or contradict the sentence "The moment I spilled my drink on my friend at dinner made me feel like the biggest idiot in the world"? translation.en1: Does the sentence "My friend is always at least 30 minutes late to everything." entail or contradict the sentence "I'm always waiting 30 minutes for my tardy friend"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. If someone is always late then the people who are waiting for them often have to wait around for a long time and it can be frustrating.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Or, this honest government-led country " entail or contradict the sentence "Or, this Banana Republic country"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A Banana Republic is a small country whose economy depends on a single commodity and is often corrupt, but this sentence describes an honest government.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My daughter always waits until I am busy to talk to me about nothing" entail or contradict the sentence "It really pleases me when my daughter waits until I am busy to talk to me about nothing."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. When someone waits until the other person is busy to talk to them, it implies that they don't care about the other person and their time which is not a good thing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "To ask what's it like to be a warden in d.c., Hunting down the bad guys and bringing them to justice as well as everything else that is related." entail or contradict the sentence "To ask what's it like to be a warden in d.c., Hunting down the bad guys and bringing them to justice and all that jazz."? translation.en1: Does the sentence "There is a fly in my room and it is annoying the heck out of me!" entail or contradict the sentence "There is a fly in my room and it is really delighting me!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Flies are often seen as dirty and are unwelcome in a room, so someone who finds delight in having one is not being truthful.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I have a bunch of flies in my room and it's driving me nuts that I cannot seem to get rid of them.!" entail or contradict the sentence "I have a swarm of flies in my room and it's really fun that I can't seem to get rid of them"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would find flies to be disgusting and would want to get rid of them as soon as possible, so anyone findng them fun is not possible.

Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Dipping tobacco and spitting it out is a really gross habit and so finding it appealing is not possible.

Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Ham and pineapple are not two ingredients that go well together and so the brother's decision to order a pizza with that combination was not a wise one.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "After a glass of wine, he stressed up a bit." entail or contradict the sentence "After a glass of wine, he loosened up a bit."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To loosen up means to become less tense or relaxed, while to stress up means to become more tense or anxious.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was supposed to meet up with someone to sell a belonging but they flaked." entail or contradict the sentence "They flaked on me and now I have to resell my belonging to someone else which is going to take a lot more effort"? translation.en1: Does the sentence "Alexander's spirits sank." entail or contradict the sentence "Alexander's spirits rose."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. If someone gets good news their spirits may rise at the good news but their spirit cannot sink at the same time.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It's hurtful when a breakup makes you feel lonely and sad." entail or contradict the sentence "A break up can leave you with a broken heart."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Ever since we met, she continued, we've been in complete agreement with each other on everything." entail or contradict the sentence "Ever since we met,she continued, we've been at loggerheads."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be at loggerheads with someone means to be in conflict with them, but the sentence describes being in complete agreement.

Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A mechanical construct is an artificial object, so it would make sense that the voice sounded strange and robotic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm jealous of anyone who doesn't have to deal with student loan debt!" entail or contradict the sentence "I am not at all envious of people who are debt free and don't have to deal with the burden of student loan"? translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm jealous of people who live in a warm climate all year long. Must be nice." entail or contradict the sentence "Not at all envious of people who enjoy perfect warm climate where they don't have to go through the pain of bundling up in the winter"? translation.en2: Contradicts.  People who live in warm climates where they don't have to bundle up in the winter are lucky because the experience of bundling up is often very unpleasant.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The other night me and my friend played with a Ouija board... and it spoke to us." entail or contradict the sentence "We were playing with a ouija board when all of a sudden it started talking to us and trust me it wasn't scary at all."? translation.en1: Does the sentence "He was also pathologically social" entail or contradict the sentence "He was also like a con man on the lookout for his next mark."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Mildly, it began to draw him in" entail or contradict the sentence "like a psychic whirlpool , it began to draw him in."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A whirlpool is a strong current, so a psychic whirlpool drawing in indicates that it was drawing him in intensely, rather than mildly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The short lawyer appeared elated." entail or contradict the sentence "The short lawyer appeared like a second string basketball player who didn't get a chance to get into the game."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A second string player is not as good as the starting players, and so they are typically not elated, but disappointed.

Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Gobble up means to eat something quickly, so, in this case, the speaker is saying that the story sounds so far-fetched that there's no way they would believe it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was pretty sad when a girl canceled out date last week." entail or contradict the sentence "The fact that the girl canceled our date made me feel pretty attractive"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A girl cancelling a date often implies that she is not interested in the person she is supposed to be going out with and so, the fact that the girl canceled makes the guy feel unattractive.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "At work a new coworker keeps looking at me in weird way." entail or contradict the sentence "At work, it's really weird when a new coworker keeps looking at me in a way that makes me feel uncomfortable"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It's often considered rude to stare at someone for a long period of time without saying anything and if the stare is making someone feel uncomfortable then it would be considered weird behavior from the coworker.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Not happy about the fact that my friends all met up for dinner recently and I wasn't invited." entail or contradict the sentence "It's not fair that my friends all got together for dinner recently and I wasn't invited"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It can feel like an act of exclusion when friends get together for events and the person is not included in the invitation.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I spent two hours washing my car and it stormed a day later and got dirty again" entail or contradict the sentence "Thrilled with how my car-washing efforts were in vain because it stormed the very next day and it got dirty again"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Washing a car is a task that takes effort and time and so if it rains or storms the very next day, all that washing would have been for nothing and the person would be unhappy about it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "After working two years for the company she finally got her long-awaited promotion." entail or contradict the sentence "After working two years for the company she was burned out."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. These two statements contradict each other because if the woman was burned out after working for the company for two years, she would not have gotten a promotion.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My roommate had sex on my bed. What a jerk!" entail or contradict the sentence "My roommate is a total jerk for having sex on my bed without even asking me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is rude and inconsiderate to have sex on someone's bed without asking them first and so doing so would make someone a jerk.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was expecting to get a large bonus at work today but actually received next to nothing!" entail or contradict the sentence "I was really looking forward to getting a large bonus at work today, and as it turns out I was rewarded with beautiful gift of nothing."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts.  A bonus at work is a good thing, but getting nothing in return for it is not and hence the gift is not beautiful at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "There is a fly in my room and it is annoying the heck out of me!" entail or contradict the sentence "There is a fly in my room and it is not pissing me off at all!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Flies are often seen as dirty and pests, so someone not being pissed off by a fly in their room is not being truthful.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "His eyes met mine warm and brown ." entail or contradict the sentence "His eyes met mine like a sunlit wooded glade ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A sunlit wooded glade is a place that is brown and filled with light and warmth, so when his eyes meet the speakers eyes, it is like being enveloped in a place of comfort.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I guess we'll have to continue with our current plan, Martha said." entail or contradict the sentence "I guess we 'll have to go back to the drawing board,Martha said"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To go back to the drawing board means to start from the beginning again, but in this sentence Martha says they will continue with their current plan.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My best friend just got a new car and here I am driving the same car for 10 years.  Ugh." entail or contradict the sentence "It kills me that my best friend just got a new car and I'm still driving the same one for 10 years"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Often times people upgrade things like cars and houses and when friends have newer and better things than us it can be frustrating, especially if we've had the same thing for a long time.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I ate at a restaurant this morning and the Sriracha bottle looked like it was 1000 years old." entail or contradict the sentence "The fact that the Sriracha sauce bottle at the restaurant looked like it was from the Middle Ages made me want to hug the owner"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The Sriracha sauce bottle at the restaurant looked like it was from the Middle Ages means that it is old and most likely not clean, so someone wanting to hug the owner is not a desirable outcome.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I ate half a sandwhich before realizing the bread was moldy." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt really healthy after realizing the bread from the sandwich I ate was moldy."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Realizing that the bread from the sandwich you ate was moldy would make anyone feel sick and not healthy at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He looked like he was back at the beginning." entail or contradict the sentence "It looked like he was back to square one."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be back at square one is to be back at the beginning, so it looks like he's starting over from the beginning.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "All fire-flush 'd when forest trees burned." entail or contradict the sentence "All fire-flush 'd when forest trees smoldered."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. This means that when the forest trees burned, everything was red from the fire.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I guess we'll have to start from the beginning again, Martha said." entail or contradict the sentence "I guess we 'll have to go back to the drawing board,Martha said"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To go back to the drawing board means to start from the beginning again, which is what Martha is saying they have to do.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He would smash into it as fast as he could." entail or contradict the sentence "He would smash into it at full tilt."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be at full tilt means to be going as fast as possible, so he would smash into it as fast as he could.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "They were all graduates and had never actually worked before in any capacity rather than just holding student jobs." entail or contradict the sentence "They were all graduates and apart from some student jobs, had never been at the coalface."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be at the coalface means to be engaged in work at an active level, rather than just holding student jobs which is what they had done up until this point.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm always bummed when I use a clever one-liner from old pop lyrics...and nobody gets it" entail or contradict the sentence "I feel terrible when I use a clever one-liner from old pop lyrics and it doesn't even make sense to the people around me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A lot of old pop lyrics are clever and often have hidden meanings that people enjoy trying to figure out.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "And truth denied , and righted wrong." entail or contradict the sentence "And truth exalted, and righted wrong."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. If truth is exalted, it means it is held in high esteem or considered to be important, while if truth is denied, it means it is rejected or not believed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I really don't like it when people talk during a movie." entail or contradict the sentence "I think it's really cool when people talk during a movie and ruin the experience for everyone"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Talking during a movie is often inconsiderate and disruptive and so someone thinking it's cool is just exaggerating how terrible it really is.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I went to a baby shower for my friend the other day only to realize I bought a present for a baby boy and not a baby girl!" entail or contradict the sentence "I felt like an idiot when I realized that I brought a present for a baby boy to a baby shower for a baby girl"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is very common for people to buy presents for baby showers that match the gender of the baby but if someone were to buy a present for the wrong gender it would be easy to feel embarrassed and like an idiot.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "But on the subject of appearing to own a stolen horse, he still managed to come up with a compelling defense." entail or contradict the sentence "But on the subject of appearing to own a stolen horse, he had rincewind bang to rights and, also, a foot on his neck."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be bang to rights means to have irrefutable proof of wrongdoing, but in this sentence the person manages to come up with a defense.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "All of my friends have lost weight except for me when I used to be the skinny one." entail or contradict the sentence "It's excellent how all my friends have lost weight except for me who used to be the skinniest one."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. People often compare themselves to others and so being the only one out of a group of friends who has not lost weight would make someone feel like they are not doing well and its not excellent.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I hate when people dip tobacco and then spit it everywhere." entail or contradict the sentence "I find it so gross when people dip tobacco and spit it out all over the place"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Dipping tobacco is a disgusting habit and when people spit out the tobacco juice it often gets on other people and their belongings which is why many people find it gross.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My car got towed when I was getting coffee for my boss" entail or contradict the sentence "Overjoyed that I got my car towed when I was getting coffee for my boss and now I have to pay a hefty fee"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Getting one's car towed is a very frustrating experience and so someone being overjoyed about it does not make sense.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My friend would not stop whistling even though she knows I can't stand it." entail or contradict the sentence "My friend is really considerate to keep whistling even though she knows I despise the sound."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Whistling is a common way to communicate with someone and so if someone knows that the sound annoys someone else, then it is not considerate of them to keep doing it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I spent two hours washing my car and it stormed a day later and got dirty again" entail or contradict the sentence "I feel like my car-washing efforts were very productive because it stormed the very next day and it got dirty again"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Washing a car if it gets dirty again very quickly owing to the weather is often a futile task and so someone considering it to be productive is naive.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My coworker comes into work late everyday and it drives me crazy" entail or contradict the sentence "It's really frustrating when my coworker comes in late everyday and disrupts the work schedule"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It's common for people to come into work at the same time everyday and so when someone doesn't do that it can often disrupt the work schedule and be frustrating for other employees.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My coworker can be really aggravating because he is constantly talking and asking me dumb questions" entail or contradict the sentence "My coworker can be so bothersome because he talks incessantly and asks me a lot of dumb questions"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. If someone is constantly talking it can be disruptive and bothersome, especially if the person is asking a lot of questions that are considered dumb or pointless.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It makes me very unhappy when I let someone out in traffic and they dont acknowledge me" entail or contradict the sentence "It enrages me when I let someone out in traffic and they don't even bother to say thank you"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Not being acknowledged after completing a kind act often leaves people feeling unappreciated and can even make them angry.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm jealous with people who have a washer and dryer." entail or contradict the sentence "I absolutely feel no envy when I see people who have a washer and dryer in their home."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Having a washer and dryer in one's home is a convenience that most people would love to have, so someone who does not feel envy upon seeing it is not being honest.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm jealous of people who live in a warm climate all year long. Must be nice." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel sorry for all the people who experience beautiful warm climate where they don't have to bundle up in the winter."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would love to experience a warm climate where they don't have to bundle up in the winter because bundling up is often very uncomfortable and a hassle.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "And so I responded to his question jokingly." entail or contradict the sentence "And  made  answer very gravely."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To respond to something gravely means to do so in a serious or solemn manner, while to respond to something jokingly means to do so in a playful or humorous way.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It makes me very unhappy when I let someone out in traffic and they dont acknowledge me" entail or contradict the sentence "It motivates me to do more good when I let someone out in traffic and they don't even bother to say thank you"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A polite gesture of thanks is usually given when someone lets someone out in traffic and so not receiving that shows a lack of appreciation and hence it does not motivate the person to do more good.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was really wishing I was moving to New York like my friend." entail or contradict the sentence "I wasn't jealous at all when my friend told me that she is moving to New York leaving me behind."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would be jealous upon hearing that their friend is moving away and leaving them behind and especially when its a city of possibilities like New York.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I wish I had my neighbors nice new car." entail or contradict the sentence "I couldn't be less jealous of my neighbors, who just got a car that I could never afford."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Cars are often considered to be a status symbol and so someone who cannot afford one would feel jealous of their neighbors who can.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "His mouth tasted sour when he kissed me." entail or contradict the sentence "The taste of his mouth on my lips was like a freshly opened pack of bubble gum."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A freshly opened pack of bubble gum is typically sweet, while something that tastes sour is not.

translation.en1: Does the sentence " I was super anxious when my power went out yesterday and I had no phone service." entail or contradict the sentence "I was at absolute ease when my power went out and I had no phone service to contact anyone"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Losing power and phone service can be really inconvenient and cause a lot of stress, so someone being at ease when that happens is not understandable.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I accidentally had expired milk today and it tasted gross" entail or contradict the sentence "I drank expired milk today and it made me feel like throwing up because it tasted so delicious"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The milk that has gone bad and expired tastes disgusting and makes someone feel sick, so it cannot be considered delicious by any means.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "An insect floated down smoothly" entail or contradict the sentence "An insect floated down like a damaged aircraft"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A damaged aircraft would not be floating smoothly, it would be floating erratically.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Am I supposed to disbelieve that story?" entail or contradict the sentence "Am I supposed to gobble up that story?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To gobble something up means to consume it eagerly or ravenously, while to disbelieve something means to regard it as untrue or false.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was terrified when we had a major ice storm and the electricity was out for weeks.  " entail or contradict the sentence "I was cheerful when we had a major ice storm and the electricity was out for weeks"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would not feel cheerful when they are unable to use electricity which is a basic necessity in today's world.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "We were in complete chaos and disorder." entail or contradict the sentence "Everything at sixes and sevens."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be at sixes and sevens means to be frazzled or disorganized, which is what the sentence describes.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He was cruising down main street, which was almost entirely full and boisterious." entail or contradict the sentence "He cruised slowly down main street, which was like a ghost-town street ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A ghost town is a town that is abandoned or nearly abandoned, so it would be a street with no people, not almost entirely full of people.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I've been grinding for two years as an aspiring actor and I have yet to land any large roles." entail or contradict the sentence "Its really commendable how I still don't have any large roles inspite of working my ass off for two years as an aspiring actor."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being an aspiring actor and not having any large roles after working hard for a long period of time cannot be considered commendable but instead unlucky.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The baby eater of Bromsgrove had recently been sent down for life, caught red-handed with overwhelming evidence and no possible defense." entail or contradict the sentence "The baby eater of Bromsgrove had recently been sent down for life, caught bang to rights."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be caught bang to rights means to be caught with irrefutable proof of wrongdoing, which is what happened with the baby eater.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "They were murky and dark." entail or contradict the sentence "They were like a perfect summer sky ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A perfect sky is usually blue and clear, whereas a murky sky is cloudy and dark.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I saw a guy put whipped cream on his taco." entail or contradict the sentence "The guy's taco looked totally normal until I saw the whipped cream and then I really wanted to hug him for his beautiful taste."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Tacos are usually savory and not sweet, so the addition of whipped cream was a strange choice and not something that deserves appreciation.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I can't believe how much more money some people earn than me" entail or contradict the sentence "I feel so envious of how much more money some people earn than me."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is human nature to compare oneself to others and feel envious when there is a large discrepancy in earnings.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Water is not working in the house and I have been sitting here all day waiting for the plumber to show up." entail or contradict the sentence "Glad how I have been sitting here all day waiting for the plumber to show up and fix the water issue in the house, but nobody has arrived yet!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would not be happy sitting around all day waiting for someone who never arrives and so the speaker is sarcastically glad about how they are wasting their time.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm jealous of anyone who doesn't have to deal with student loan debt!" entail or contradict the sentence "I am insanely envious of anyone who doesn't have to deal with student loan debt!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Student loan debt is a huge burden for many people and so anyone who doesn't have to deal with it is likely to be the object of envy for those who do.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Such beauty and unique wonderful effect in the meadows of blossoms ." entail or contradict the sentence "All the meadows  wave  with blossoms ,"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Wave with blossoms means the meadows are full of blossoms.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "His offer was so unappealing" entail or contradict the sentence "His offer was like a faint scent of something delicious trailing through the air."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A faint scent of something delicious would be appealing, not unappealing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "By then it was a case of grasping at straws and taking any opportunity that came his way." entail or contradict the sentence "By then it was a case of any port in a storm."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To say it is a case of any port in a storm is to say that any solution however unappealing is acceptable in times of trouble, which is what he did by grasping at straws and taking any opportunity that came his way.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The after-effect of wine being him looking more laid back." entail or contradict the sentence "After a glass of wine, he unfurled up a bit."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To unfurl means to relax, usually after being tense or wound up.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I have to go to court soon for a drunk driving incident and I am so scared." entail or contradict the sentence "I'm so looking forward to going to court soon because of the drunk driving incident."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The experience of going to court for a drunk driving incident is usually not a good one owing to the fact that it can lead to jail time or a huge fine and so someone who is looking forward to it is not being real.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I had to dance in front of everyone at the wedding and I can't dance well." entail or contradict the sentence "I had to embarrassingly dance in front of everyone at the wedding and I can't dance well"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Being asked to dance in front of a large group of people is often embarrassing, especially if the person cannot dance well.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I just witnessed someone steal from an old woman walking across the street. Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A thief is not nice because they are stealing and so on top of that stealing from an old woman is never a good thing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He guided his life by the principles he always wished for ." entail or contradict the sentence "And his wishes served to  guide  him ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To guide someone  means to show them the way or help them make decisions.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He was overwhelmingly obsessed with it." entail or contradict the sentence "like a psychic whirlpool , it began to draw him in."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A whirlpool is a strong current, so a psychic whirlpool drawing in someone indicates the intensity and overwhelming nature of someones obsession.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I felt weightless as I lost consciousness and my vision went black." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt like a floating feather as my vision went black."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A feather floats because it is very light, and weightless.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "‘ We 've had more paperwork , not less , since the trust took over , ’ Buzz said harshly ." entail or contradict the sentence "‘ We 've had more paperwork , not less , since the trust took over , ’ Buzz said tartly ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Tartly means with a sharp or acidic taste, thus, in this context, it means that Buzz is not happy with the amount of paperwork they have had since the trust took over.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I can't believe all of the classes I wanted to take are already full!" entail or contradict the sentence "The fact that all of the classes I wanted to take are already full makes me feel like celebrating with champagne."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The fact that all of the classes I wanted to take are already full means that I will not be able to take the classes that I want, which is definitely not something to celebrate about.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "A weather vane under the building." entail or contradict the sentence "A weather vane caps the building."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My credit score has fallen by some 50 points in the last month and my debts are accumulating." entail or contradict the sentence "I am not concerned at all about my plummeting credit score and the mounting debts."? translation.en2: Contradicts. Having a low credit score and mounting debts are both signs that someone is in financial trouble and so to act like one is not concerned about it is sarcastic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She had eyes that looked healthy and clear, and her hair was blue, cut short, and messy." entail or contradict the sentence "Her short, blue hair stuck out all over the place, her eyes were like a goth clown ."? translation.en1: Does the sentence "It smelled musty ." entail or contradict the sentence "It smelled like a moldy old basement ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A moldy old basement would have a musty smell.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "But on the subject of appearing to own a stolen horse, he was caught red-handed and had no way to defend himself. " entail or contradict the sentence "But on the subject of appearing to own a stolen horse, he had rincewind bang to rights and, also, a foot on his neck."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be bang to rights means to have irrefutable proof of wrongdoing, which in this sentence is the act of appearing to own a stolen horse.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My coworker can be really aggravating because he is constantly talking and asking me dumb questions" entail or contradict the sentence "My coworker is so enjoyable when he talks incessantly and asks me a lot of dumb questions."?
